Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Layout

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Layout
  • public class Layout
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the layout (intended as map) of the game

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.List<AmmoSquare> ammoSquares
      Contains all the ammo squares of the selected layout, size is up to 9
      private int[][] existingSquare
      A matrix: if the square at coordinates x and y is in squares, then existingSquares[x][y] is 1, otherwise it's 0
      private java.lang.String jsonFileFolder
      It's the path of the json file in order to create a layout
      private static int LAYOUT_HEIGHT
      Height of layout
      private static int LAYOUT_WIDTH
      Width of layout
      private int layoutConfiguration
      an integer representing the chosen layoutConfiguration (used for saving)
      private java.util.List<SpawnSquare> spawnSquares
      Contains all the spawn squares of the selected layout, size is always 3

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Layout​(java.util.List<SpawnSquare> spawnSquares, java.util.List<AmmoSquare> ammoSquares, int layoutConfiguration)
      Build layout with passed ammoSquare and spawnSquares.

      • spawnSquares

        private java.util.List<SpawnSquare> spawnSquares
        Contains all the spawn squares of the selected layout, size is always 3

      • ammoSquares

        private java.util.List<AmmoSquare> ammoSquares
        Contains all the ammo squares of the selected layout, size is up to 9

      • existingSquare

        private int[][] existingSquare
        A matrix: if the square at coordinates x and y is in squares, then existingSquares[x][y] is 1, otherwise it's 0

      • jsonFileFolder

        private java.lang.String jsonFileFolder
        It's the path of the json file in order to create a layout

      • layoutConfiguration

        private int layoutConfiguration
        an integer representing the chosen layoutConfiguration (used for saving)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Layout

        public Layout​(java.util.List<SpawnSquare> spawnSquares,
              java.util.List<AmmoSquare> ammoSquares,
              int layoutConfiguration)
        Build layout with passed ammoSquare and spawnSquares. Keep track of layoutConfiguration
        Parameters:
        spawnSquares - list of spawn squares
        ammoSquares - list of ammo tile squares
        layoutConfiguration - configuration code

    • Method Detail

      • getSquares

        public java.util.List<Square> getSquares()
        Returns a list with all the squares of the layout, both of type AmmoSquare and SpawnSquare
        Returns:
        cloned list with all squares

      • getVisibleSquares

        public java.util.List<Square> getVisibleSquares​(Square startingSquare)
        Returns all the squares that are, at most, 3 movements far from startingSquare and, if it has door, also every square in the room on the other side of the door and, in the end, it return the squares in the room of startingSquare
        Parameters:
        startingSquare - The square from which calculates the visible ones; squares contains it
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing visible squares

      • getSquaresInDirection

        public java.util.List<Square> getSquaresInDirection​(Square startingSquare,
                                                    Direction d)
        Returns all the squares that are in the specified direction, starting from startingSquare (included)
        Parameters:
        startingSquare - The square from which calculates the direction
        d - Selected direction
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the found squares

      • getSquaresInDirection

        public java.util.List<Square> getSquaresInDirection​(Square startingSquare,
                                                    Square pointingSquare)
        Returns all the squares in the direction specified by startingSquare (not included) and pointingSquare (included), if they're aligned or, if they're overlapping, it returns the all square in the four cardinal direction, starting from startingSquare
        Parameters:
        startingSquare - The first square from which calculate the direction
        pointingSquare - The second square from which calculate the direction
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all the found squares; it could be empty

      • getSquaresInDistanceRange

        public java.util.List<Square> getSquaresInDistanceRange​(Square startingSquare,
                                                        int min,
                                                        int max)
        Returns all the squares whose distance, from startingSquare, is between min (included) and max (included)
        Parameters:
        startingSquare - The square from which calculates the distance
        min - Lowest distance
        max - Highest distance
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all the found squares; it could be empty

      • getHorizontalSquareLine

        public java.util.List<Square> getHorizontalSquareLine​(int y)
        Returns all the square whose second coordinate is y
        Parameters:
        y - The selected horizontal line
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all the found squares; it could be empty

        public java.util.List<Square> getCardinalSquares​(Square startingSquare)

        Parameters:
        startingSquare - The square with selected coordinates
        Returns:
        An ArrayList with all the found squares

        Parameters:

        Returns:
